channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- EazyDocs
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- EazyDocs

item.title: CVE-2023-6035|2024-08-02T08:21:17.100Z -- unknown -- eazydocs
item.description: The EazyDocs WordPress plugin before 2.3.4 does not properly sanitize and escape "data" parameter before using it in an SQL statement via an AJAX action, which could allow any authenticated users, such as subscribers, to perform SQL Injection attacks.

item.title: CVE-2023-6029|2024-08-02T08:21:17.211Z -- unknown -- eazydocs
item.description: The EazyDocs WordPress plugin before 2.3.6 does not have authorization and CSRF checks when handling documents and does not ensure that they are documents from the plugin, allowing unauthenticated users to delete arbitrary posts, as well as add and delete documents/sections.

item.title: CVE-2024-0248|2024-08-01T17:41:16.584Z -- unknown -- eazydocs
item.description: The EazyDocs WordPress plugin before 2.4.0 re-introduced CVE-2023-6029 (https://wpscan.com/vulnerability/7a0aaf85-8130-4fd7-8f09-f8edc929597e/) in 2.3.8, allowing any authenticated users, such as subscriber to delete arbitrary posts, as well as add and delete documents/sections. The issue was partially fixed in 2.3.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-3999|2024-07-02T06:00:02.531Z -- unknown -- eazydocs
item.description: The EazyDocs WordPress plugin before 2.5.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-0248|2024-02-12T16:07:33.907Z -- unknown -- eazydocs
item.description: The EazyDocs WordPress plugin before 2.4.0 re-introduced CVE-2023-6029 (https://wpscan.com/vulnerability/7a0aaf85-8130-4fd7-8f09-f8edc929597e/) in 2.3.8, allowing any authenticated users, such as subscriber to delete arbitrary posts, as well as add and delete documents/sections. The issue was partially fixed in 2.3.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-3999|2024-07-02T15:31:50.935Z -- unknown -- eazydocs
item.description: The EazyDocs WordPress plugin before 2.5.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3999|2024-08-01T20:26:57.231Z -- unknown -- eazydocs
item.description: The EazyDocs WordPress plugin before 2.5.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)
